Package org.blockchainnative.annotations

Annotation Type ContractMethod

  • @Retention(RUNTIME)
@Target(METHOD)
public @interface ContractMethod
    Declares a method to be mapped the corresponding method of a smart contract.
    Contract methods can use the following return types:
    • Any type supported by the underlying provider
    • Any type if an appropriate type converter is registered
    • Any of the above wrapped in type Result
    • Any of the abover wrapped int Future or CompletableFuture
    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    ContractWrapperGenerator, Result

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element Description
      boolean isReadOnly
      Declares whether or not the smart contracts method is meant to be invoked in a way so that it is modifying the blockchain's state.
      boolean isSpecialMethod
      Marks the method to have a special meaning to the underlying provider.
      java.lang.Class<? extends TypeConverter<?,?>> useTypeConverter
      Explicitly specifies a type converter to convert the smart contract's result object to the methods declared return type.
      java.lang.String value
      Explicitly specifies the name of the method to be called in the associated smart contract.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        java.lang.String value
        Explicitly specifies the name of the method to be called in the associated smart contract.
        If no name is specified (i.e. an empty string) the name of the method to which this annotation is applied is used.
        Returns:
        name of the method to be called in the associated smart contract.
        Default:
        ""

      • isReadOnly

        boolean isReadOnly
        Declares whether or not the smart contracts method is meant to be invoked in a way so that it is modifying the blockchain's state.
        If set to true, the blockchain provider is instructed to call the method without modifying the blockchain as long the system supports non-modifying calls.
        If such behavior is not supported, an UnsupportedOperationException is to raised when invoking the method.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating whether this method is declared as readonly or not
        Default:
        false

      • isSpecialMethod

        boolean isSpecialMethod
        Marks the method to have a special meaning to the underlying provider.
        How this method is interpreted is up to provider.
        Returns:
        boolean indicating whether this method is declared as special method or not
        Default:
        false

      • useTypeConverter

        java.lang.Class<? extends TypeConverter<?,?>> useTypeConverter
        Explicitly specifies a type converter to convert the smart contract's result object to the methods declared return type.
        If no converter (i.e. NoOpTypeConverter) is declared, the provider will try to find a matching converter registered with TypeConverters or attempt to convert the type with its built-in mechanism (if supported).
        Returns:
        specific type converter class to be used.
        Default:
        org.blockchainnative.convert.NoOpTypeConverter.class
